com.teamwork.autocomplete

Interface MultiAutoComplete


  • public interface MultiAutoComplete
    The main MultiAutoComplete component, it manages the type adapters and holds a reference to the managed MultiAutoCompleteTextView. It also provides lifecycle methods to attach/detach the view itself.

    The managed MultiAutoCompleteTextView can be styled and used as normal. Once configured, the library will take care of calling MultiAutoCompleteTextView.setTokenizer(MultiAutoCompleteTextView.Tokenizer) and AutoCompleteTextView.setAdapter(ListAdapter) and present the data for you when there is a token match.

    It holds an "adapter of adapters" internally, with which the component can handle multiple data types in the same instance and decide which adapter to use for filtering depending on what kind of token is being typed in.

    To create an instance use one of the static factory methods in MultiAutoComplete.Build or, for full customization, use the MultiAutoComplete.Builder itself.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MultiAutoComplete.Build
      Static factory helper methods to construct an instance of MultiAutoComplete with default parameters.
      static class  MultiAutoComplete.Builder
      MultiAutoComplete concrete implementation builder component.
      static interface  MultiAutoComplete.Delayer
      Delegate interface for the hidden Filter$Delayer interface, used to delay the filtering of the text constraint on the MultiAutoCompleteTextView.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onViewAttached(MultiAutoCompleteEditText view)
      Call this when the view gets attached to the component using MultiAutoComplete.
      void onViewDetached()
      Call this when the view gets detached to the component using MultiAutoComplete, to avoid memory leaks or usage of a view that is no longer on screen.

    • Method Detail

      • onViewAttached

        void onViewAttached(@NonNull
                    MultiAutoCompleteEditText view)
        Call this when the view gets attached to the component using MultiAutoComplete. This is usually done in Activity.onCreate(Bundle) or Fragment.onViewCreated(View, Bundle).
        Parameters:
        view - The MultiAutoCompleteEditText view that this MultiAutoComplete will be managing.

      • onViewDetached

        void onViewDetached()
        Call this when the view gets detached to the component using MultiAutoComplete, to avoid memory leaks or usage of a view that is no longer on screen. This is usually done in Activity.onDestroy() or Fragment.onDestroyView().
